sect2.title: Education and scientific carrier
sect2.para: 1979 B. Sc. in Ecology together with other biological subjects and inorganic and physical chemistry at Lund university.
After exam I went directly to graduate school. Completed PhD. D. in Zoology 1985 with a dissertation within computational and theoretical population biology and evolutionary ecology.

During 1986 I was Post-Doc at Parasite Epidemiology Research Group, Dept. of Pure and Applied Biology, Imperial College, London. Thereafter I stayed within Academia until I became Docent in Theoretical ecology 1995.
This CV is about what I did after 1995.

sect2.title: R & D within the library sector
sect2.para: Since 1995 I've been working with R & D within digital libraries. Joined NetLab that year, the development department of Lund university library. NetLab disappeared when we became part of the University Librarian's Office in Lund. Less research and more development.
From 2005 I work at Royal Danish Library, Copenhagen.

I do just about every kind of development you can do at a really big library. Most of what I've done is related to digitization of our collections to provide digital access to them. We model and create of digital cultural heritage objects. I try in vain to avoid the library catalogue. A more detailed list of my experience could look like this:

listitem.para: Programming: JAVA is my preferred programming environment for larger projects. I also Bourne (again) shell, Ruby (also on rails) and Perl. For what it's worth now I am an expert on XML technologies. More on that below. I can do C and PHP. In the past I was fluent in Pascal and FORTRAN. I have never really mastered Python or Lisp.

Search engines for the Web around 1995: I have developed a harvester and built search indices, subject base information gateways and metadata based databases. Early on we built one called Nordic Web Index , Desire , Safari , Studera.Nu . These were a early precursors of what is now referred to as semantic web. We combined metadata searching with with full text web search, an idea that is mainly dead now. In connection with this I was engaged in the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI). I left the DCMI Advisory Board 2007. .
MerMEId System for scientific cataloging of sheet music using Music Encoding Initiative (MEI) XML format .

The Guaman Poma Web Site: Guaman Poma was an Inca noble man and his work El Primer Nueva Corónica Y Buen Gobierno is most likely the only preserved extensive text describing the Spanish colonialism from the perspective of the Indians..
During 2008 this single work had about 250 000 visitors (defined as the number of users staying more than 30 minutes).

Sjauiga an attempt to migrate legacy digitized objects to a newer portable platform, based on a XML web service delivering content in METS format from a old Oracle database. The platform contains more than 1500 objects.

The now defunct S:t Laurentius Digital Manuscript Library. I described the service at DRH 2002 and wrote a paper about it.. This service was introduced me to the area of computing called Digital Humanities.
XML and document and text technologies. One of my deepest interests is the search and navigation of literary text.

For such texts, basically everyone is still using XML technologies. The alternative formats are still (even 2019) more or less bad jokes. The longer and larger and more complex, the bigger the challenge and the greater the interest. For most of our projects we use Text Encoding Initiative documents.
I have close to twenty years experience using XSLT, XPath, XML Document Object Model (DOM), XQuery language.
Database technologies: Have used Oracle, MySQL and SQLite. I have some experience with Hibernate and its query language HQL.
Text search and retrieval: Prefer Apache SOLR and Lucene over Oracle Text and My SQL full text indexing.
Indexing of XML document: I have built an extensive infrastructure for indexing long texts based on originally Lucene and later SOLR.
Document are typically indexed down to paragraph (for prose), strophe (poetry) and dialogue (scenic arts).

sect2.title: Other information
sect2.para: I am married and have two adult children and two grandchildren.
